news_list.title: The last caste census was in 1931. A look back at its findings
news_list.description: The Union Cabinet Committee on Political Affairs (CCPA) has announced that it will launch a caste census in India, the first such exercise since the 1901 Census was conducted by the colonial British government and is being carried out by the Congress-led UPA government for more than 20 years. It is not yet clear how many votes castes have been counted in the 1931 census, but some of them are expected to be taken into account.

news_list.title: Transgender women footballers barred from playing in women’s game in UK
news_list.description: Transgender women will be barred from playing in England’s women’s football on June 1 if they are not registered transgender players, the Football Association has announced. The decision comes after a ruling that the term “woman” refers only to a biological woman. It comes on the back of the ruling from Britain’s supreme court that the word “woman" in the Equality Act refers solely to an asexual woman.

news_list.description: Pakistan’s Olympic gold medal winning javelin thrower Arshad Nadeem became the latest athlete from the neighbouring country to have his Instagram account blocked in India in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack. Users attempting to access Nadeem’s Instagram page from India are met with the message: “Account not available in India. This is because we complied with a legal request to restrict this content.” Earlier in the week, former Pakistan cricketers Sho

news_list.title: 2026 Women’s T20 World Cup final to be played at iconic Lord’s; Check out full list of venues
news_list.description: The ICC Women’s T20 World Cup 2026 final will be held at Lord’s Stadium on July 5th, the International Cricket Council has announced in announcing its plans for the 2016-2017 ICC women’s cricket tournament to be held in London. It is one of seven venues confirmed for the 2017–18 ICC Ladies' T20 world cup final and will take place between June 12th and 24th.

news_list.title: He’s a more mature player now: Punjab Kings coach Ricky Ponting lauds captain Shreyas Iyer
news_list.description: Punjab Kings coach Ricky Ponting has praised Shreyas Iyer after his 72-wicket win over Chennai Super Kings led to a 4–0 victory in the Indian Premier League last season, according to BBC Radio India's Daily Mail news agency on Thursday. The former Kolkata Knight Riders man is now more mature than ever before, and says he understands the game and game situations probably better than never before.

"It was an emotional knock because just a few days before, the team for the Australia tour was announced," he said on the TV show's survivor news programme.

news_list.title: ‘Sometimes we’ve been naive, a bit dumb’: Mark Wood on England players’ comments to media

We’ve got to be respectful. (But) I’m not kicking off at the other players.”

news_list.title: LeBron James says he doesn’t have answer to questions about his future after LA Lakers exit NBA playoffs
news_list.description: LeBron James has said he will break the NBA’s long-term longevity record, which he shares with Vince Carter in an interview on Wednesday evening at the Los Angeles Lakers Sports Hall of Famer's website. “I don’t have the answer to that. Something I’ll sit down with my wife and my support group and kind of just talk through it, and see what happens,” he said.

news_list.description: Inter Milan manager Simone Inzaghi praises teen star Lamine Yamal after the UEFA Champions League semi-final match against Barcelona on Wednesday, according to BBC Sport. "He’s the kind of talent who is born every 50 years, I had never seen him live and he really impressed me today," he said in a press conference at the club's home ground. news_list.title: Andre Agassi’s professional pickleball debut off to winning start as he partners teenage star
news_list.description: Andre Agassi is now racking up wins in pickleball too! The eight-time Grand Slam champion, who retired from professional tennis in 2006, seems to have found a second wind in a similar-feeling-but-different sport: Pickleball! news_list.title: Vignesh Puthur out of IPL 2025, Mumbai Indians sign Raghu Sharma as replacement
news_list.description: The five-time champions have announced that Raghu Sharma is a replacement for Puthur, who made his IPL debut for the Mumbai franchise this season. He was born in Punjab’s Jalandhar and has represented Punjab and Puducherry in domestic cricket at an economy rate of 9.08 per cent. This marks his maiden stint in the IPL. He joined MI at his base price of 30 lakhs from the RAPP list.

news_list.title: ‘I love chasing on any field, thrive under pressure’: Shreyas Iyer after helping PBKS beat CSK by 4 wickets
news_list.description: Indian Premier League champions Punjab Kings were back on winning ways after chasing down 191 to beat Chennai Super Kings at Chepauk in Wednesday’s Indian Premier league match. It was Shreyas Iyer who controlled the innings well and guided PBKS to a four-wicket win with his 72 off 41. He added valuable partnerships with Prabhsimran Singh, Nehal Wadhera and Shashank Singh.

news_list.description: Kolkata Knight Riders scored a century as the Indian Premier League champions were eliminated from the IPL 2025 Playoffs race at the Chepauk on Wednesday evening, while CSK lost their fifth straight match to Royal Challengers Bengaluru after a high profile loss to Rajendra Chahal in the last two matches of the season. It is a new low for CSK as they have missed the playoffs in back to back seasons.

news_list.title: IPL 2025: End of road for CSK as Punjab Kings inflict more home misery at Chepauk
news_list.description: Punjab Kings beat Chennai Super Kings 190 to go second in the IPL table at Dharamsala for their last three home matches, but they are still out of the tournament after just two points and a draw with Sri Lanka's top-ranked Indian side Sushil Bharatiya Janata on Wednesday. It is not yet clear how long it will take them to reach the semi-finals of this year's IPL.

news_list.title: Competitors as individuals, fastest as team: Gurindervir, Animesh, Manikanta, Amlan set 4x100m national record in 1st attempt

news_list.title: Chennai Super Kings become first team to be eliminated from IPL 2025 playoffs race
news_list.description: Sam Curran scored a century as Chennai Super Kings beat Punjab Kings to reach the IPL playoffs in back to back editions of the World Cricket League (IPL) and play-offs for the first time since their defeat by Punjab Kings on 29 June. The Indian Premier League champions have been eliminated from the tournament after losing to Punjab Kings by 4 wickets at the start of the season, but they failed to qualify for the Play-Offs.

news_list.title: ATM transaction fee revision: How much more will customers pay from May 1?
news_list.description: India's Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has lowered its ATM interchange fee to Rs 23 per transaction from May 1 to 2025, the RBI has said in a statement. It will be effective from May 1, 2025 and customers will have to shell out more money for using Automated Teller Machines (ATMs) as the fees are increased by Rs 2 to 23 from Rs 21. news_list.title: Maharashtra Day Share Market Holiday 2025: Are BSE and NSE open or closed today, May 1? Check details here
news_list.description: The Bombay Stock Exchange and the National Stock Exchange of India will be closed today, on Thursday, May 1, 2025, for the entire trading session, from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM, in observance of Maharashtra Day. It's a significant Observance that is observed annually on May 1, marking the foundation of Mahaashtra as a separate and independent state from the division of the Mumbai division on May 1 1960.

news_list.title: Opinion trading platforms: Why SEBI has warned investors against dealing with them
news_list.description: India’s Securities and Exchange Board has warned investors against dealing with ‘opinion trading platforms’ a new segment in the country’s burgeoning online real money gaming and betting market, which allows users to win money by placing bets on the likelihood of a real-life event taking place. So far, such platforms – which are regulated in countries like the United States – largely went under the regulatory radar in India, but government agencies now appear to

news_list.title: Pahalgam attack aftermath: India closes airspace for all Pakistani aircraft
news_list.description: Pakistan’s West Asia, Europe, the UK, and North America's eastern region – but it is unlikely to be as significant as India’s booming aviation sector. The ban will be in place till the early morning of May 24, as per the current Notam. On April 24, Pakistan had closed its airspace for Indian aircraft and planes operated, owned, or leased by Pakistani airlines and operators, including military flights.

news_list.title: Term deal for Russian oil off the table for now; US crude purchases to depend on commercial viability, says Indian Oil chairman Sahney
news_list.description: Indian Oil Corporation (IOC), which is also India’s largest refiner, is not in “any active negotiations” for a term deal with Russian oil majors like Rosneft, according to Indian Oil Chairman Arvinder Singh Sahney. "We are not in any active negotiations...We are waiting and watching because every day things are changing. Every day the situation on tariffs, the crisis on sanctions are changing."

news_list.title: Before Pahalgam, J&K planned ambitious tourism push to bring in revenue, jobs
news_list.description: The J&K government has launched a comprehensive tourism policy in the wake of the terror attack in Pahalgam and the closure of 49 prominent tourist destinations in Jammu and Kashmir, as it seeks to boost tourism’s contribution to the region’s GDP by up to Rs 1.15 per cent over the next four to five years. It is also seeking to increase tourism's revenue from tourism for FY25 at Rs 50 crore.

news_list.title: ITR notified by Income Tax department: Taxpayers can now disclose capital gains in ITR-1
news_list.description: The I-T Department has notified income tax returns for assessment year 2025-26 (financial year 2024-25) which will enable the filing of returns in April 1st, 2025 and 26th. It is now possible to file details of capital gains under section 112A not exceeding Rs 1.25 lakh and does not have any brought forward loss or loss to be carried forward by taxpayers who have only long-term capital gains.

news_list.title: In US-China stand-off, why Washington is likely to blink first
news_list.description: Trump’s “liberation day” imposition of reciprocal tariffs against the rest of the world has been whittled down into a bilateral trade war with China, according to a report by the Financial Times. The US currently has in place a 145 per cent tariff on Chinese imports, along with restrictions on exports of ‘rare earths’ to the US. news_list.title: How India can build 5,500 km of e-highways by 2027: National Highways for EV’s Abhijeet Sinha explains

Candidates who appeared in the West Bengal Mathematical Exam 2025 will be able to check their online scores on the official websites of the WB Board at wbbse.wb.gov.in and wbresults.nic.in.

news_list.title: University of Western Australia to set up its first India campus, eyes Mumbai as hub
news_list.description: The University of Western Australia (UWA), ranked among the world’s top 100 universities, has submitted an application to the University Grants Commission (UGC) to establish multiple branch campuses in India, with Mumbai selected as the primary hub. UWA is set to become the first Australian Group of Eight (Go8) university – often likened to the Ivy League – to set up a physical campus in India.

news_list.title: UPSC Exam Calendar 2025: Indian Economic Services, Combined Medical Services exam schedule out
news_list.description: Candidates who are registered to appear for these upcoming exams can now access and check the detailed timetables from the official website of UPSC at upsc.gov.in. news_list.title: Over 60,000 students register to appear for NEET (UG) exam in Haryana
news_list.description: A total of 162 examination centres have been established across Haryana, the state's chief secretary has said in a joint statement to the NTA on Wednesday. The meeting was attended by Director General of Police Shatrujeet Kapur, Director, Higher Education, Rahul Hooda and senior officials from the National Testing Agency (NTA) as part of a review of the state’s preparedness for the exam.

news_list.title: Karnataka SSLC 10th Result 2025 Live Updates: KSEAB to be declare SSLC results tomorrow

Students can check their results available at the official karresults.nic.in by entering their roll number and date of birth. A total of 8,96,447 students appeared for the SSLC exams, including 4,61,563 male and 4,34,884 female students in the board exams this academic year.

news_list.title: NEET-UG: NTA identifies, reports Instagram, Telegram channels ‘claiming to have access’ to Q paper
news_list.description: The National Testing Agency has identified 106 Telegram and 16 Instagram channels that are “engaged in spreading misinformation and attempting to mislead students,” according to NTA sources. news_list.title: TS EAMCET Answer Key 2025 to be out this week, raise objections till May 6
news_list.description: TS EAMCET Answer Key 2025: The Telangana State Council of Higher Education (TSCHE) has officially announced the release schedule for the TS EAPCET 2025 Agriculture & Pharmacy (A&P) stream provisional answer key. Candidates who appeared for the examination will be able to view the response sheets, master question papers, and the preliminary answer key starting from May 4, 2025 (12 pm) to May 6, 2025 12 pm.

Students who took their WBBSE class 10th board exams can now download their results from the official website, wbbse.wb.gov.in. The WB Madhiamik result will be available for download at education.indianexpress.com.
